Module contents#

anonymity.tools.data_fly(table: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ident: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], qi: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], k: int, supp_threshold: int, hierarchies: dict = {}) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame#

Data-fly generalization algorithm for k-anonymity.

Parameters

  • table (pandas dataframe) – dataframe with the data under study.

  • ident (list of strings) – list with the name of the columns of the dataframe. that are identifiers.

  • qi (list of strings) – list with the name of the columns of the dataframe. that are quasi-identifiers.

  • k (int) – desired level of k-anonymity.

  • supp_threshold (int) – level of suppression allowed.

  • hierarchies (dictionary) – hierarchies for generalization of columns.

Returns

anonymized table.

Return type

pandas dataframe

anonymity.tools.incognito(table: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, hierarchies: dict, k: int, qi: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], supp_threshold: int, ident: Union[List, numpy.ndarray]) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame#

Incognito generalization algorithm for k-anonymity.

Parameters

  • table (pandas dataframe) – dataframe with the data under study.

  • ident (list of strings) – list with the name of the columns of the dataframe. that are identifiers.

  • qi (list of strings) – list with the name of the columns of the dataframe. that are quasi-identifiers.

  • k (int) – desired level of k-anonymity.

  • supp_threshold (int) – level of suppression allowed.

  • hierarchies (dictionary) – hierarchies for generalization of columns.

Returns

anonymized table.

Return type

pandas dataframe

anonymity.tools.k_anonymity(table: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, hierarchies: dict, k: int, qi: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], supp_threshold: int, ident: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], method: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame#
anonymity.tools.l_diversity(table: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, sa: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], qi: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], k_method: str, l: int, ident: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], supp_threshold: int, hierarchies: dict, k: int) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame#
anonymity.tools.t_closeness(table: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, sa: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], qi: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], t: float, k_method: str, ident: Union[List, numpy.ndarray], supp_threshold: int, hierarchies: dict) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame#

Return the l-diversity value as an integer. Calls the get_diversities and extract the minimum l-diversity level.

param table

dataframe with the data under study.

type table

pandas dataframe

param sa

list with the name of the columns of the dataframe. that are sensitive attributes.

type sa

list of strings

param qi

list with the name of the columns of the dataframe. that are quasi-identifiers.

type qi

list of strings

param t

threshold for t-closeness

type t

float

return

table that covers t-closeness.
